name: House of Cards (Season 2)
summary:
在情人节那天来一场《纸牌屋》（House of Cards）马拉松如何？Netflix宣布第二季全13集将在2月14日全部放出。 

在大卫·芬奇（David Fincher）执导的这部政治剧第二季中，弗朗西斯【Francis，凯文·史派西（Kevin Spacey）饰】和克莱尔【Clair，罗宾·怀特（Robin Wrigh）饰】将继续他们无情的上位之路，而佐伊【Zoe，凯特·玛拉（Kate Mara）饰】离犯罪事实的真相越来越近。迈克尔·吉尔（Michel Gill），寇瑞·斯托尔（Corey Stoll）和杰拉尔德·麦克雷尼（Gerald McRaney）也将出演本片。
info:
• 中文名: 纸牌屋（第二季）
  • 执行制片人: Kevin Spacey、David Fincher
  • 主演: Kevin Spacey
  • 制作: Netflix
  • 集数: 13
  • 开始: 2014-02-14
  • 结束: 2014-02-14
  • 类型: 政治 / 剧情
  • 国家/地区: 美国
  • 语言: 英语
  • 每集长: 58min
  • 电视网: Netflix
  • 视频制式: Univisium (2:1 Aspect) / 4K (UHDTV)
  • 音频制式: Dolby Digital 5.1
  • 官方网站: http://movies.netflix.com/WiMovie/House_of_Cards/70178217
  • imdb_id: tt2811510
  • wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_of_Cards_(season_2)
  • 原作: House of Cards(novel) by Michael Dobbs, House of Cards(UK TV series) by Andrew Davies
  • 音乐: Jeff Beal
  • 摄影: Eigil Bryld
  • 编剧: Beau Willimon / Laura Eason / John Mankiewicz / Bill Cain / Kenneth Lin / David Manson / Bill Kennedy
  • 导演: James Foley / John Coles / Carl Franklin / Jodie Foster / Robin Wright

eps.name: Chapter 14
eps.desc: Doug Stamper (Michael Kelly) warns Frank Underwood, the newly selected Vice President of the United States, about journalists digging into the death of Congressman Peter Russo (Corey Stoll). Frank aims to clear up all the connections that tie him to the death; in the process, he ends up killing Zoe Barnes (Kate Mara) by pushing her into an oncoming Metro train. Stamper, meanwhile, forcibly relocates Rachel Posner (Rachel Brosnahan). Frank makes a new ally in Jacqueline "Jackie" Sharp (Molly Parker), a former war hero and his choice for the House Majority Whip. Claire Underwood (Robin Wright) deals with former employee Gillian Cole (Sandrine Holt) by pulling a few strings and offering her the Clean Water Initiative nonprofit. Claire also consults a doctor about her wanting to get pregnant, but later decides not to do any tests.

eps.name: Chapter 15
eps.desc: Frank takes office while his home is upgraded with security features. Meanwhile, Secretary of State Catherine Durant's (Jayne Atkinson) team bungles a trade meeting with China in a deliberate effort to frustrate President Walker's (Michel Gill) billionaire advisor, Raymond Tusk (Gerald McRaney). As rivals negotiate to thwart her, Jackie maneuvers to strengthen her position for the post of House Majority Whip. Lucas Goodwin (Sebastian Arcelus) looks for a hacker on the Deep Web to access Frank's phone records and establish a connection between him and the deaths of Zoe and Russo. He also contacts his former boss Tom Hammerschmidt (Boris McGiver), who tries to convince him to stop his investigations. Frank struggles to keep his calm at a military ceremony when Claire informs him she was once raped by a newly commissioned general, Dalton McGinnis (Peter Bradbury).

eps.name: Chapter 16
eps.desc: Walker crafts a State of the Union address. Frank seeks bipartisan agreement with Senate Majority Leader Hector Mendoza (Benito Martinez) to avoid a government shutdown. Eventually the Senate Republicans attempt to fillibuster, which forces Frank to take drastic measures to achieve a legislative agreement. Lucas unsuccessfully pursues former Russo lover Christina Gallagher (Kristen Connolly) and further establishes contact with hacker Gavin Orsay (Jimmi Simpson), who claims to be able to help him retrieve Zoe's cell phone records. Doug sets up a sting operation to nab Lucas. Rachel contacts her mother and meets Lisa Williams (Kate Lyn Sheil), even though Doug has forbidden her to make friends.

eps.name: Chapter 17
eps.desc: The Underwoods are scheduled for their first major interview since Frank has become Vice President. The Capitol is quarantined and evacuated after a suspect package with white powder is sent. Frank gets locked in with Donald Blythe (Reed Birney). Claire preps with her publicist Connor Ellis (Samuel Page) and decides to do the interview solo. During a live mostly scripted interview with Ashleigh Banfield (cameo), which reveals much of Claire's background, Claire reveals that she had an abortion and that she was sexually assaulted by General McGinnis. She’s then supported by a woman who was assaulted by him as well. Jackie and Remy Danton (Mahershala Ali) lobby for votes to avoid the government shutdown. Meanwhile, as Lucas delves into Deep Web research, and his contact Gavin is revealed to be an FBI informant. Frank and Claire once again enjoy a smoke at their window, and Frank sings the murder ballad "Pretty Polly" for her.

eps.name: Chapter 18
eps.desc: After an erotic opening scene, Frank holds back channel trade negotiations with Xander Feng (Terry Chen), a wealthy businessman connected to both Tusk and the Chinese government regarding the building of a bridge over the Long Island Sound from Port Jefferson, New York, to Milford, Connecticut - all in the shadows of a Civil War reenactment. In so doing he drives a wedge between Tusk and the President and develops a bond with a reenactor playing an unknown Underwood ancestor. Lucas goes to the extreme to seek justice, but in doing so he walks right into the trap the FBI had set for him on Doug's behalf. Before, Gavin wanted to offer him a way out but was threatened therefore by the FBI. Team Underwood expands under dark circumstances: Seth Grayson (Derek Cecil) uncovered evidence that Claire had an abortion which was not due to her being raped by the general and now extorts Claire to hire him and get rid of Connor Ellis. Claire, with support from First Lady Patricia Walker (Joanna Going), advocates with military officials for sexual assault victims.

eps.name: Chapter 19
eps.desc: Rachel battles the heat wave. Tusk and Frank discuss the energy crisis caused by China's samarium price hike. Unable to get Walker's ear, Tusk allies with Frank. Walker agrees to Frank's suggestion to purchase samarium elsewhere. Lucas fights a plea deal of 7 years versus 35. Claire and Tricia Walker meet regarding advocating military oversight and when Christina interrupts them, Claire plants the seed that the President might be sleeping with Christina. Rachel helps Lisa at the church, but Doug tells her to stop. Tom visits Lucas in prison and takes over his research. Jackie and Remy meet on legislation to pressure Tusk. They sleep together. Remy realizes Tusk will fight the President's legislation. Frank tells Walker to stand firm. Claire encourages Christina to liberally avail her help to the Walkers. As Tom uncovers dirt, Doug tells FBI liaison Green (Jeremy Holm) to make Lucas take the deal. Meanwhile, Frank meets Tom to stonewall him headon. Green coerces Janine (Constance Zimmer) to discredit Tom and Lucas' story. Frank goes to Camden Yards to throw out the first pitch and a Tusk company shuts off the power. Tusk says this could happen anywhere. Frank encourages Walker to seize Tusk's power plants. Tom and Janine tell Lucas Frank is going to go free. Frank and Tusk meet at Freddy's (Reg E. Cathey) to reconcile to no avail. Doug tells Rachel the heat is off, but she feels Doug has the hots for her.

eps.name: Chapter 20
eps.desc: Midterm election attack ads alarm the Democrats. Walker attempts to cut off their funding. Frank finds out Tusk is financing them through a Kansas City casino and sends Doug to research. Jackie and Remy meet again. Claire and Frank pressure Jackie to stand behind Claire's legislation. Ellis and Grayson battle over strategy and Remy meets double agent Grayson. Grayson has Remy get Ellis out of the way. Doug discovers that Feng is behind the casino money and flies to China to negotiate. Frank finds out Tusk has been influencing his colleagues in Congress. Wall Street Telegraph reporter Ayla Sayyad (Mozhan Marnò) starts linking Tusk and Feng. Frank figures out Grayson is working for Remy and decides to use him. Tricia and the President fight over Christina. The Underwoods host the Walkers to a dinner catered by Freddy and cozy up to them as Claire reminds Tricia that a marriage is more lasting than the Presidency. Jackie attempts to stall Claire's legislation and defies Frank. Feng relays through Doug that he will stop funding the Republicans when the Port Jefferson Bridge approved. Media attention has Freddy's business booming and financiers attempt to buy him out. Frank meets with casino owner Dan Lanagin (Gil Birmingham) to cut off Republican funding, but Lanigan prefers Tusk's money to the influence that Frank offers.

eps.name: Chapter 21
eps.desc: Rachel agrees to host Lisa. Frank tries to get Linda to convince Walker to approve the bridge plans. Frank begins to advocate for the Ugaya Native American tribe. Claire and Tricia vow to stand behind McGinnis accuser Megan. Claire asks Tricia about the President's support, but they are estranged. Claire suggests counseling. Remy and Jackie discuss where they stand and where the attack ad funding is coming from. Frank lobbies Walker for the bridge. Tricia decides to pursue counselling and Remy tracks down Adam Galaway (Ben Daniels). Sayyad continues finding clues and confronts Grayson about Frank and Tusk. Frank meets Lanagin in Missouri. Lanagin surprises Frank with Tusk as a guest and outflanking him with the Ugaya. Tusk offers Democratic funding for help mending his estrangement with Walker. Frank has Doug arrange a meeting with Walker that Linda cancelled. Frank and Linda have a pissing contest. Remy figures out that Grayson has sold him out. Rachel and Lisa become intimate. Tricia convinces Walker to go to counselling. Walker also commits to Frank's bridge deal. Linda resigns. Megan backs out of her press conference. Doug confirms with Feng that the bridge deal is approved and asks him to shun Tusk. Remy and Tusk decide to get aggressive with Frank.

eps.name: Chapter 22
eps.desc: Freddy sees Clair's scandalous picture on the front page of the newspaper. Claire and Frank strategize with Stemper and Grayson. Freddy agrees to sell his business. He then offers to buy his son, Darnell Hayes (Malcolm Goodwin), and grandson, Deshawn Hayes (Darren Alford) a new house. Eventually his son accepts and begins working for Freddy. Claire tells Galloway to deny the picture and their affair. Claire then says that the picture was an innocent one that Galloway had taken by request, controverting Galloway. Doug and Grayson fight to be top dog. Remy coerces Galloway into releasing another picture of Claire. Sayyad questions Tusk after linking him to Feng. Tusk threatens her. Tusk asks Remy to uncover more dirt on Frank. Remy reveals Freddy's criminal past. Frank attempts to protect Freddy. Meanwhile Freddy's son violates his parole by threatening a photographer with a gun. Grayson replicates the second photo with an anonymous model. When Frank realizes Freddy's new problems, he distances himself and Freddy understands. Adam explains that he released the second photo because of a threat to his fiancee, Inez (Carme Boixadera). Galloway claims the whole thing was a publicity stunt under pressure from Claire.

eps.name: Chapter 23
eps.desc: Doug and Rachel argue. Frank grapples with a bomb threat at his home while dealing with a military standoff between China and Japan. As Remy and Jackie become closer, Frank discovers their relationship. Claire and Jackie tussle over Claire's legislation but do not come to terms, which leads to Frank's involvement. Meechum guards Claire. Tensions arise between Frank and Walker over the back-channel dealings with Feng, which Walker was not informed of. Sayyad uncovers a PAC scandal that becomes public.

eps.name: Chapter 24
eps.desc: Frank is interrogated by Dunbar. Claire's legislation loses steam. Frank, Doug and Grayson scheme. Remy asks questions. Megan gets back involved. Frank, Claire and Meechum let down their guard. Doug deals with personal issues.

eps.name: Chapter 25
eps.desc: Walker accuses Frank of setting him up, and the two break contact. Jackie is derided by the press. Frank convinces Durant and Dunbar to offer Feng immunity and asylum. Jackie attacks Claire in the press. Doug tells Rachel to put out Lisa. Gavin presses Agent Green for his freedom. Claire tries to reconcile with Jackie and drops the bill, which leads to a falling out with Megan. Dunbar interrogates Frank and Larkin. Tusk is subpoenaed but pleads the fifth. Grayson divides Tusk and Remy. Claire requests Jackie's help in guiding Walker's impeachment. While resistant at first, Frank and Claire convince Jackie that preventing Walker's impeachment will spell disaster for the Democratic Party in the midterm elections.

eps.name: Chapter 26
eps.desc: Tusk is now the only one who can guarantee Frank's destruction by revealing Frank's knowledge of secret, fraudulent dealings with Feng. Walker offers Tusk a pardon in return for implicating Frank. Frank advises Tusk against it, but Tusk refuses to listen. Linda Vasquez speaks on behalf of Walker during her testimony. Claire consoles Megan, who rebukes her. Meanwhile, Gavin, having infiltrated AT&T's cell servers, has enough leverage to press Green for a meeting with Doug, who ultimately agrees. In the face of upcoming midterms, Jackie works to secure votes for impeachment, per Frank's request. Claire, afraid that her and Frank's plan is failing, pushes Frank to reconcile with Walker. Walker and his wife go to Camp David to avoid the press. Frank, in an attempt to gain Walker's good graces once again, appeals to his emotions in a letter and even offers to assume responsibility for the money-laundering accusations that have severely damaged Walker's approval ratings. Walker contacts Frank after reading the letter, but is not fully convinced of Frank's sincerity. He states that in order to gain his trust, Frank will have to produce results by whipping enough votes to save Walker from impeachment. Frank agrees, and after reaching this deal, Walker calls off his offer to Tusk. Jackie seeks Remy, who still has feelings for her. Tusk appears in a hearing, and initially pleads the fifth, but after realizing that Walker has abandoned him by rescinding his pardon offer, testifies against the President and claims that he knew about the money-laundering. The nation is in an uproar and Walker's approval ratings drop to single-digits. Doug meets with Gavin, and Gavin (having hacked Doug's phone) knows about his meetings with Rachel. He demands protection from the FBI in return for keeping quiet. Doug, believing that Rachel has contacted someone without informing him, meets with Rachel and demands for her to tell him the truth. She denies revealing anything about the two of them, but Doug does not believe her. At a traffic light, Rachel flees the car and runs into the woods. Doug pursues her, but she attacks him with a rock and kills him. Meanwhile, the House pursues impeachment. Walker, seeing no hope in surviving impeachment amidst the nation's demands, resigns. He and Frank part on friendly terms. Frank is sworn in as President of the United States, and immediately negotiates an end to the military standoff with China by rescinding Feng's immunity and asylum and sending him back to China. Claire has remade Frank's class ring (which he buried earlier in the season at a Civil War memorial). He puts it on in the oval office, and knocks it on the desk twice before the screen cuts to black and the season ends.

like.name: 权力的游戏 第四季
